dailyInsights.marketOverview: AI infrastructure thesis dominates. While broad tech took a breather last week, the AI buildout narrative remains structural. Valuations are stretched but justified by growth rates. Crypto showing strength on regulatory tailwinds and Bitcoin momentum. Watch: labor data this week (softening market focus), which could trigger Fed rate cut hopes.

topNews.title: Japan's Nikkei 225 crosses 57,000 for first time as Takaichi secures historic mandate
topNews.insight: Bullish for global risk assets. Yen weakness = USD strength, which pressures commodities but supports tech exporters. Japanese LDP's pro-growth agenda likely means continued BOJ accommodation. Good for risk-on sentiment.

topNews.title: Stock futures tick higher as markets await closely watched jobs, inflation reports
topNews.insight: Market is front-running softer labor data. If employment continues to weaken, Fed rate cut odds rise, which benefits growth stocks. Our AI infrastructure portfolio is positioned well for a dovish pivot. Key risk: inflation resurges.

topNews.title: NVIDIA confirms $660B AI capex commitment is sustainable, CEO reaffirms outlook
topNews.insight: This IS the story. NVIDIA's capex commitment is not a guess—it's customer commitments. This validates our entire AI infrastructure thesis (SMCI, PSTG benefit too). When THE constraint (GPU supply) is being solved, downstream businesses flourish.

dailyInsights.marketOverview: Tech rotation ongoing but AI infrastructure remains the strongest thematic. Labor market softening is the biggest macro risk. Fed watching closely. Crypto showing strength on regulatory clarity hopes.

topNews.title: Japan's Nikkei 225 crosses 57,000 for first time as Takaichi secures historic mandate
topNews.insight: Takaichi's election victory signals policy stability in Japan. Could strengthen yen and affect US-Japan trade dynamics.

topNews.title: Stock futures tick higher as markets await jobs, inflation reports
topNews.insight: Market is pricing in softer labor data. Watch upcoming employment figures—they'll drive Fed policy expectations.

topNews.title: Tech giants continuing AI spending despite softening tech sector
topNews.insight: NVIDIA and MSFT commitment to AI capex is structural, not cyclical. This supports our tech allocation.
